data-definition:
seems to return like getName1 but with useName true
$(find-instance $art_image_chunk $$).images[$] (describe-obj $.name)
A - even, B - uneven for tone patterns, A - unstressed, B - stressed for accent patterns
"a chosen subject"
"a historical figure" or a specific figure "an abstract concept" or a specific concept
"different readings depending on word breaks" "can be read backwards as well as forwards" "can be read orthogonally across the standard lines" "emerge when reading along certain prescribed paths across the body of the poem"
"originating in ..." "originally devised by ..."
patterns will be tone patterns if set, otherwise accent patterns 'applied by poets to produce individual poems' if set, otherwise 'guides poets during improvised performances'
"certain lines often ... and they sometimes ..."
"is a narrative/... poetic form"
"use of ... is characteristic of the form" or "must feature lines which ..."
"line, couplet, tercet" if set, "brief verse paragraphs"/"full verse paragraphs" otherwise
"has X to Y couplets/..."
size_in_lines is set: line, couplet, tercet, quatrain, quintain, etc. size_in_lines is not set: "brief verse" if less than 6, otherwise "full verse"
"the Nth line has XX feet"
"first line must make use of ..."
"The XX line ZZ of ... on YY line" ZZ
YY XX
"it has lines with ... syllables" "it has lines with a tone/accent pattern of ..."
"it has ... caesura in each line"
"certain lines have ..." same as additional_features above
"written from the perspective of ..."
-- tempo styles
-- 10
-- 20 -- dynamic styles
-- 30
-- more tempo styles
-- overall styles
-- 40
-- 50
-- 60
-- 70
'applied by composers to produce individual pieces of music' if set, otherwise 'guides musicians during improvised performances'
-- 10
-- 20
-- 30
-- 0
-- 10
-- 20
-- 30
-- 40
